frame.name: Attention
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns a <fen>Perceiver</fen>'s state of readiness to process and consider impressions of a <fen>Figure</fen> within a <fen>Ground</fen>. It is often unknown to the <fen>Perceiver</fen> whether or not the <fen>Figure</fen> exists within the <fen>Ground</fen>. Alternatively, the <fen>Expressor</fen> may be expressed as showing signs of the <fen>Perceiver</fen>'s state of attentiveness.
<ex>Legislator tells <fex name="Perceiver">consumers</fex> to <ment>be</ment> <t>alert</t> <fex name="Figure">to dioxin levels</fex>.</ex>
<ex>They demand an <t>attentive</t> <fex name="Expressor">gaze</fex>, a careful accounting of parts.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Perceiver
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual that pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Ground
FE.definition: <def-root>The sensory field or subset of a sensory field that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is attending to.</def-root>

FE.name: Figure
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is specifically focussing on within the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of attention that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is paying to the <fen>Figure</fen> or <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The situation within which the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is alert.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably, presumably, mysteriously</ment>), force (<ment>hard, softly</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Perceiver</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity (or event) associated with a <fen>Perceiver</fen> that gives evidence for a <fen>Perceiver</fen>'s attentiveness.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: alert.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: quick to notice and respond

lexUnit.name: attention.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the mental faculty of considering or taking notice

lexUnit.name: close.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of observation or examination) done in a careful and thorough way

lexUnit.name: ignore.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to deliberately pay no attention to something
